meanings.definition: Software or hardware that has been advertised but is not yet available for purchase.
meanings.sent1: The company's new game was just vaporware, as it never actually hit the shelves.
meanings.sent2: Many customers were disappointed when the highly anticipated product turned out to be vaporware.
meanings.sent3: The CEO's promise of a revolutionary device turned out to be nothing but vaporware.
meanings.sent4: The excitement around the upcoming release quickly faded when it was revealed to be vaporware.
meanings.sent5: The concept of vaporware often leads to frustration among consumers waiting for the product.

meanings.definition: A product or project that is announced but never actually released.
meanings.sent1: The tech industry is no stranger to vaporware, with many hyped products never seeing the light of day.
meanings.sent2: The company's latest announcement turned out to be nothing more than vaporware.
meanings.sent3: The team's ambitious project ended up being just another case of vaporware.
meanings.sent4: Investors were disappointed to learn that the much-anticipated product was just vaporware.
meanings.sent5: The market is flooded with vaporware, promising innovation but delivering disappointment.

meanings.definition: Empty promises or claims that are never fulfilled.
meanings.sent1: The politician's speech was filled with vaporware, offering grand plans with no substance.
meanings.sent2: Don't fall for their vaporware, as they never follow through on their promises.
meanings.sent3: The company's marketing campaign was criticized for being full of vaporware.
meanings.sent4: His extravagant promises turned out to be nothing but vaporware.
meanings.sent5: The CEO's speech was dismissed as vaporware, lacking any real commitment or action.
